text: Great food, very good serving quantity with wonderful owners. Highly recommended. Liked the halal wings and philly stake fries

Falafels platter not worth price. The falafels have a good texture, but lacks flavor. Previously the falafel platter, according to another yelpers picture, was 4.99 and came with 5 falafels and fries. Now it costs 6.99 and they added two falafels to the patter for a total of 7 falafels. It comes with a "sauce" which is basically just seasoned ketchup and hot sauce mixed, for both the fries and falafels. I'm not sure I want to try their other food if this is thought they put into their platters. Thanks, but no thanks.

Gave this place a try for the first time, and man was it good, I just wish I got MORE! Haha. I had the chicken kebab burrito which came with a small side of fries, was very delicious! What made it all more better was the two owners, who were very nice when they greeted me and had made sure they got everything right on my order. Definitely will be coming back! Next time, I'm getting more!

great pizza and delicouce subs , cheap and tasty
I always order on phone and pick it up 
I love the pizza and chicken kabab and need kobideh and spaghetti their prices is fear and they have always spacial for pizza everyday for pick up , the owners are really friendly and nice .just try i am sure I will love their food

The food here is awesome! Perfect late night drunk food. The owner is very personable and we always appreciate helping out the smaller businesses, you just get a more homey feel when they are able to chat. Would definitely come here again, the garlic sauce pizza, and the loaded fries are delish!

Very good pizza! Not too oily and everything is freshly made. Very friendly people also :) 
- Erika M

Deliciois Pizzas with a lots of toppings and fresh Sandwiches
Definitely recommend it. Even more for those that like Persian taste.

Never had a bad experience when i order food with them,my wife love their healthy bowl , pizza burger and i love their Persian pizza with lots of topping  ,philly steak asada fries,koobideh kabob, fresh and yummy food i am  going to try all their food menu and kids love the mini crescent dogs with nacho cheese when we order usually.suggest all their food and you are going to enjoy it

Ordered delivery recently via Yelp/Eat 24. They forgot the fries and falafel sauce on both sandwiches that we ordered. I tried to call the restaurant after we realized this, but nobody answered, so I contacted the Yelp/Eat 24 help, got a response the next day advising that they would contact the restaurant about it, and haven't heard back since. It would be nice if the restaurant would compensate me for the missing items.

There are so many reasons to go there. Food quality Pricing, friendly staffs and the most important one is the honest owner who cares about the customers and their comments about the food. Very convenient  for students due to the location. I have tried the sosis nadari, persian tanori sassage, jigar and del and Persian spaghetti. All of them were good , tasty and can be customized with their available options ( like more chili, extra cheese and so on) . By the way this is a fast food style so don't expect the fine dining tables or silverwares. It is self serve,fast quick but delicious and tasty. 
Also if you like to try a Persian drink go for yogurt drink( dough) . They have the homemade style dough.
Best Persian style pizza in the town in my opinion. It has a crispy crust and fresh topping, the cheese is a whole different experience from American style pizza.

Every college food court needs a staple pizza joint- this is CSN's option, along with Persian kabobs, salads, and sandwiches. The prices are low and the toppings are plenty, don't miss out on the mortadella and ground beef. If you're feeling adventurous, try the Olivie salad, which is similar to a potato salad and similar to a dish found in Russian cuisine. I've yet to try the kabobs, but they were highly recommended by another regular so we'll be back to try them soon.

I am going to be really honest because I wanted to like this place. I have been away from home and wanted to find a place that had amazing middle eastern food as I missed home cooking. 

Maybe I am too hard because I know authentic.

Lets start with the location- it is located in a food court that is randomly located and hard to find. There is nothing wrong with it but something to mention. 

I ordered pigs in a blanket with cheese dipping sauce (best thing I ate on the menu) 
as well as the kobideh- ground beef skewers- there were 2 which was nice and rice. 

I asked for onion on the side and that was left out. 

Mostly my lack of stars was the lack of taste and the rubbery meat. It was dry, and lacked everything. I dont know if they over worked the meat and made it too gluey. I honestly ate one bite and threw it away. 

I dont think i will be back even though i typically give places more than one try since there are so many other middle eastern restaurants to try. I know they do Ubereats and everything else for deliveries.
Super nice and bomb food. I'll be stopping by again. Make sure you try their persian pizza its super bomb. The owners are very nice and show you lotz of love. :)

Oh my goodness I can not say enough good things about this place! The staff is very very friendly. Not sure why the yelp says close because they're open. I was craving Persian pizza and this exceeded my expectations. I also tried the tanuri hot dog and the bandari and both were incredible! Give it a try you won't be disappointed

The workers were very kind and concerned about the quality of my meal. They took great care in making sure that all of the food was cooked to the best of their ability. I was very impressed with my meal and the service! My rice, vegetables, and chicken were delicious.
Ordered Assad fries for delivery. Arrived at the time estimated and driver was very friendly. Will definitely order from here again.

Hey everyone! Please try this place out! We have been getting takeout and delivery from here for a year and love it. Food is awesome and the owners are so sweet. Small business owners trying to make it. Give them your business, please!
Great tasting food and fresh food the pizza is great with a lot of topping and the sandwich's are fresh and sooo tasty. I totally recommend it. If you want fresh great tasting food check them out.
Found this while driving around. Great food. Can't beat the price. Staff were very friendly and accomodating. Pizza, wings and fries were all fantastic. Service was fast and efficient.

Have you ever had cheeseburger pizza? Probably. And I'm sure it was great. Now step your game up and get you a pizza burger. That's right. A cheeseburger wrapped inside pizza dough baked to perfection. I'm not sure what sorcery goes on in their kitchen to make the veggies still perfectly crisp and not at all soggy despite having been cooked in an oven underneath a blanket of pizza dough, but damn is it magical. But that's just the tip of the iceberg. I've never ordered anything from here that wasn't simply divine. I could legitimately live off of the healthy chicken bowl. And all of the praise for the amazing food is a moot point when you factor in how wonderful the entire family that owns this place is. It feels good gorging yourself on pizza burgers when you know you're supporting a really amazing family to continue doing what they're passionate about.

The Best Persian Cuisine I have enjoyed in a very long time.  Delightful Owners, Generous
Portions.  Everything Fresh and Healthy.  No Junk here.  Even the Pizza's are a Vegetarian
Delight.  My daughter and I enjoyed the Koodibeh Kebab (Item 1) very much.  The portions were so large, we were even able to share some of my husband's Persian Sausage Sandwich.
While we were waiting for our order, The Owner's Wife gave us a Delicious and generous sample of a cold salad made of potato, egg, chicken, mayo, pickles.  I can't remember the name of the dish but can't wait to go back and get more.  Yummy!

THE BEST PERSIAN FOOD IN LAS VEGAS. It is located in a building labeled Internet cafe but once you find it you will not be disappointed. Their pizza is to die for and taste exactly like the ones from Iran. The man that worked there was so sweet and kept checking up on us. Seriously so good just try it and you won't be disappointed!

Don't be misled by the Internet Cafe Marquee. Inside this buidling across the street from the Charleston CSN campus lies a hidden Persian Bistro offering a variety of authentic Iranian Dishes. Their Koobideh Kabob and the Persian Pizza offer a taste of Persian cusine @ a reasonable/student price. Their service is also noteworthy.

Ordered delivery from Pizza House late one night after being left hungry the night before by a different restaurant. 

Delivery was timely and the driver called before leaving the restaurant. Very friendly and didn't need any help finding the place. 

Persian spaghetti was as advertised: spaghetti with peppers, onions, and Persian meat. The meat was delicious but the rest of the dish was fairly ordinary. Pretty tasty, but nothing to write home about.

Moo's favorite meatball bowl was a disappointment. The dish consisted of food service meatballs served over fresh basmati rice with a tiny bit of shredded cheese sprinkled on top. The rice was delicious but the meatballs left us asking "who would call these their favorite?" This was OK but not great. 

Chicken creamy and sweet garlic pizza was the shining star of our meal. This pizza has a lot going on and yet the flavors were perfectly balanced and delicious. The crust was properly crispy and light, not heavy at all. All the flavors were very fresh. I'm looking forward to trying other pizzas from this place as it's clearly one of their strengths.

Just ordered from this restauarant for the first time. I ordered the koobideh kabob and the Persian Pizza. I am not Persian myself but grew up very close to the persian family of my best friend and enjoyed excellent persian cooking prepared by her mother;  because of this I am almost always dissapointed when I order persian food from a restaurant. The kabob was excellent, the flavor was spot on. Was it as good as "mom" used to make? No, but nothing ever is and I was not dissapointed in the least. I ordered the pizza to share with my boyfriend when he gets home from work but could not resist to try a piece with lunch and it was bomb! Tons of toppings and the crust was so thin and crispy.  I ate 2 pieces and probably would have kept going if I would not have to admit to eating so much later!

The price was fair, delivery was fast, and the young man who delivered it was courteous and super cute as well!  I'm glad I found this place and will definitely order from here again next time I'm working from home and the fridge is empty!

I had the persian style homemade pizza and let me tell you something!!! This was best and delicious pizza i had since i moved from home. Omg im so glad i found this place ao i can have my favorite pizza just like back home. 
It didn't took long for them to get the pizza ready. Great customer service. 
I definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Excellent yummy Persian pizza and Great selections of traditional and Mexican pizzas to satisfy everyone. Me and my family had the Carnitas Michoacan with queso fresco  , the mexican comes with bacon , chorizo and more ....mmmmm delicious. We've never left this place dissatisfied.  When visiting Las Vegas, this is the only place for pizza  y mira que te lo digo Yo. !!!!!!!

Hands down the best pizza I've had in Vegas ! Better than any Italian joint in the city - it took the Persians to get it right ! The pizza arrived fresh and hot , the sauce was great  and the crust was INCREDIBLE ! The wings were perfect and the fries are always fantastic - it's the family owned establishment - just SO happy I've discovered a local pizza place that's on fire and even more happy that I'm able to support and small business person and sweet family here in town - can't wait to ry everything on the menu !!!!!

Very tasty with a whole lot of options you just don't see every day. 

Persian Tanouri Sausage? Yes, that's fooorme! 

Beef Kobideh? Oh yeah! 

Persian Spaghetti? Absoletti! (I really enjoyed this. It's the same, but different (and cheap, too). 

Mexican? Pizza? There is a little bit of everything and it's all wonderful. Heck, they even have chicken nuggets and Crescent roll wrapped mini dogs for the kids. I swear I'm going to try the Philly Steak Asada Fries some day. How many layers of Fusion is THAT? 

Super friendly owners who make sure you are enjoying the food. Lots of love in this food, folks.
What a great find! Amazing pizza the crust is so delicious. Persian pizza is non-traditional but absolutely worth a try.

Very enjoyable persian twist on a burrito! I had the chicken kabab burrito, with extra sauce on the side. It had a good kick to it. The family who runs it is also very friendly and helpful. The Persian digestive cookies they had to go with my tea order were a nice touch!
Good just like back home and the good is freshly made. Always fresh home made meals and also... for the fitness freaks they have health chicken bowls!!! Y'all know what that means GAINZZZZZZ

Pizza meets Persian! The pizza crust is  a bakery quality bread product that could stand on its own. Also liked Persian sausage, gyros, and Kabob sandwiches and pitas. Exceeded my expectations. Located in The Campus Commons Food Court across from CSN @ Charleston & Torrey Pines next to Premier Car Wash and Walgreens. Deff worth a visit!
